text: CBS, short for "Columbia Broadcasting System", is one of the largest television networks in the United States. CBS may also refer to: ==Business== * CBS Corporation, a former American mass media corporation and the parent company of the American television network * CBS Records International, the now-defunct international arm of Columbia Records *CBS(South Korean network) or Christian Broadcasting System is a Korean Christian TV network. ==Technology, science, international development== * CBS catalyst or Corey–Bakshi–Shibata catalyst, a catalyst in chemistry * CBS reduction or Corey-Bakshi-Shibata reduction * Charles Bonnet syndrome, visual hallucinations in the blind * Combined braking system, a system for linking front and rear brakes on a motorcycle or scooter * Container-based sanitation, a sanitation system where toilets collect waste in removable containers * Component-Based Servicing, a management feature introduced in the Windows Vista operating system * Concrete block structure, a building structure built from concrete masonry units * Cystathionine beta synthase, an enzyme which catalyzes the first step of the transsulfuration pathway * Credit-based shaper, a network scheduler defined in IEEE 802.1Qav, inspired by credit-based fair queuing == Geography == * Coatbridge Sunnyside railway station, Scotland (station code) * Columbus (Amtrak station), Wisconsin, United States (station code) * Conception Bay South, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada == Institutes == * Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek, the Dutch national institute of statistics * Centraalbureau voor Schimmelcultures, the Dutch institute of fungus studies * Centre for Excellence in Basic Sciences, an autonomous Indian national institute in Mumbai * Israel Central Bureau of Statistics, the Israeli national institute of statistics == Educational centers == * Calcutta Boys' School, India * Christian Brothers School in many places * Cologne Business School, Germany * Colonel Brown Cambridge School, Dehradun, India * Columbia Business School, Columbia University, New York City, USA * Copenhagen Business School, Denmark * La Ceiba Bilingual School, Honduras * University of Minnesota College of Biological Sciences ==Christianity== * Campus Bible Study group at the University of New South Wales, Australia * Campus by the Sea, Catalina Island, California, USA * Chronological Bible Storying * Confraternity of the Blessed Sacrament, an Anglican devotional society == Other uses == * Central Broadcasting System or "Radio Taiwan International", Republic of China radio station * Centralne Biuro Śledcze Policji, a Polish police unit * Croatia Boat Show == See also == * CBS Television (disambiguation)
title: CBS (disambiguation)
